column4: How do I edit "/etc/X11/xorg.conf"? nothing happens when I try to write
you need to be root. what editor are you using?
I did it as sudo with gedit
say it's gedit. then type 'sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf' in a terminal window
after you've finished the edit, you need to restart x
the problem is I can't edit it..nothing happens when I try to write and so on..
oh, you mean when you try to type?
that only happens to me when i start gedit *without* sudo
also, check the permissions on /etc/X11/xorg.org -- try 'ls -l /etc/X11/xorg.conf'
it should look something like this: '-rw-r--r--  1 root root 3036 2005-04-13 22:13 /etc/X11/xorg.conf'
How stupid am I really..I didn't do it as sudo after all..I seem to become blind..
